info.description:
## Introduction
**Advanced and reliable API for accessing comprehensive Ethereum blockchain data.**

- **Free Usage Policy:** The API is free to use under a fair use policy, with rate limits of 10 requests per minute per IP.
- **Caching:** All responses are cached for 1 minute.
- **Higher Usage Plans:** For higher usage plans, visit: [https://beaconcha.in/pricing](https://beaconcha.in/pricing). An API key is required to use these plans.

### API Key Usage
API keys can be obtained at [/user/settings](https://beaconcha.in/user/settings) and must be included in requests either as a query string parameter or in the request header.

#### Example: Query String Parameter
```bash
curl https://beaconcha.in/api/v1/slot/1?apikey=<your_key>
```

#### Example: Request Header
```bash
curl -H 'apikey: <your_key>' https://beaconcha.in/api/v1/slot/1
```
info.title: beaconcha.in API Documentation

get.description:
Provides the health status of all modules of the explorer. This endpoint is useful for monitoring the availability and functionality of the explorer's components.
- **Modules Monitored:** Includes monitoring of services such as `monitoring_app`, `monitoring_el_data`, `monitoring_services`, `monitoring_cl_data`, `monitoring_api`, `monitoring_redis`.
- **Response Details:** Returns the status of each module. If all modules are operational, the response will indicate success. Otherwise, it will return an error with details about the failing modules.
Health endpoint to monitor the operational status of the explorer (used for load balancer health checks)
Returns charts from the page https://beaconcha.in/charts as PNG

parameters.description: Chart name (see https://github.com/gobitfly/eth2-beaconchain-explorer/blob/master/services/charts_updater.go#L20 for all available names)
parameters.name: chart

post.description: Used in consensus layer clients to submit stats to your beaconcha.in account. This data can be accessed by the app or the user stats api call.

parameters.description: User API key, can be found on https://beaconcha.in/user/settings
parameters.name: apikey

parameters.description: Name your device if you have multiple devices you want to monitor
parameters.name: machine

get.description: Get the address for an ens name and vice versa. Returns and object with the ens name and address - if found.
get.summary: Resolve an ens name or address

parameters.description: domain can either be an ens name or an etherum address
parameters.name: domain

get.description: Returns information for a specified epoch by the epoch number or an epoch tag (can be latest or finalized)

parameters.description: Epoch number, the string latest or the string finalized
parameters.name: epoch

get.description: Returns all slots for a specified epoch

parameters.description: Epoch number, the string latest or string finalized
parameters.name: epoch

get.description: Get the deposit information for a given eth1 transaction hash.

parameters.description: Eth1 transaction hash
parameters.name: txhash

get.description:
ETH.STORE® represents the average financial return validators on the Ethereum network have achieved in a 24-hour period.
For each 24-hour period the datapoint is denoted by the number of days that have passed since genesis for that period (= beaconchain-day)
See https://github.com/gobitfly/eth.store for further information.

parameters.description: The beaconchain-day (periods of <(24 * 60 * 60) // SlotsPerEpoch // SecondsPerSlot> epochs) to get the the ETH.STORE® for. Must be a number or the string 'latest'.
parameters.name: day

get.description: Returns the ether balance and any token balances for a given Ethereum address. Amount of different ECR20 tokens is limited to 200. If you need more, use the /execution/address/{address}/erc20tokens endpoint.

parameters.description: provide an Ethereum address consists of an optional 0x prefix followed by 40 hexadecimal characters
parameters.name: address

parameters.description: filter for a specific token by providing a ethereum token contract address
parameters.name: token

get.description: Returns the ERC20 token balances for a given Ethereum address. Supports pagination.
get.summary: Get ERC20 token balances for address

parameters.description: provide an Ethereum address consists of an optional 0x prefix followed by 40 hexadecimal characters
parameters.name: address

parameters.description: data offset
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: data limit (ranging from 1 to 200)
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Get execution blocks by execution block number

parameters.description: Provide one or more execution block numbers. Coma separated up to max 100.
parameters.name: blockNumber

get.description: Gets the current estimation for gas prices in GWei.. The response is split into four estimated inclusion speeds rapid (15 seconds), fast (1 minute), standard (3 minutes) and slow (> 10 minutes).

Get a list of proposed or mined blocks from a given fee recipient address, proposer index or proposer pubkey.
Mixed use of recipient addresses and proposer indexes or proposer pubkeys with an offset is discouraged as it can lead to skipped entries.
get.summary: Get proposed blocks by address, proposer index or proposer pubkey

parameters.description: Either the fee recipient address, the proposer index or proposer pubkey. You can provide multiple by separating them with ','. Max allowed index or pubkeys are 100, max allowed user addresses are 20.
parameters.name: addressIndexOrPubkey

parameters.description: Offset
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Limit the amount of entries you wish to receive (Maximum: 100)
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Sort via the block number either by 'asc' or 'desc'
parameters.name: sort

get.description:
Returns the most recent pixels that have been painted during the last 10000 slots.
Optionally set the slot query parameter to look back further.
Boundary coordinates are included.
X = 0 and Y = 0 start at the upper left corner.
Returns an error if an invalid area is provided by the coordinates.

parameters.description: Start X offset
parameters.name: startx

parameters.description: Start Y offset
parameters.name: starty

parameters.description: End X limit
parameters.name: endx

parameters.description: End Y limit
parameters.name: endy

parameters.description: Start slot to query (end slot - 10000 if empty)
parameters.name: startSlot

parameters.description: End slot to query
parameters.name: slot

parameters.description: Only return end state of each pixel
parameters.name: summarize

get.description:
Returns the sync-committee for a sync-period. Validators are sorted by sync-committee-index.
Sync committees where introduced in the Altair hardfork. Peroids before the hardfork do not contain sync-committees.
For mainnet sync-committes first started after epoch 74240 (period 290) and each sync-committee is active for 256 epochs.

parameters.description: Period ('latest' for latest period or 'next' for next period in the future)
parameters.name: period

get.description: Get your client submitted stats

parameters.description: Data offset, default 0

parameters.name: limit

post.description: Exchange your oauth code for an access token or refresh your access token

grant_type.description: grant_type use authorization_code for oauth code or refresh_token if you wish to refresh an token

code.description: Only required when using authorization_code grant type. Code received via oauth redirect_uri

redirect_uri.description: Only required when using authorization_code grant type. Must match the redirect_uri from your oauth flow.

refresh_token.description: Only required when using refresh_token grant type. The refresh_token you received during authorization_code flow.
